div.head: Messy Data, messy results
div.p: Assigning people to their affiliated organizations seems to be an easy task. Especially when the contributors of the conference were in charge of providing this data. Unfortunately neither the famous conftool provides some kind of controlled vocabulary (or automatic norm data linking) of organisations/institutions nor do the single institutions enforce some kine of naming conventions. As a result of this we got e.g. four different names for the ACDH-OeAW.

A first consolidation of this mess was done in regards of compiling the book of abstracts. This data was then automatically processed (python) to link the contributors to their organisations. This worked quite well (let's say 75%). The rest of the data/linking was done manually. Anyway we do not claim that the current result is free of errors. Therefore everyone is invited to look into the data and correct any errors. Ideally by fixing the data data/indices/listorg.xml and data/indices/listperson.xml and making a pull-request to this application's code repo.
